text: ambassador what can you tell us what's
the latest about what's happening with
the repatriation of the holidaymakers
we're making progress here in Sharma
shape today the first two flights back
to the UK are boarding as we speak each
with about 180 passengers on board
they'll be leaving in the next half an
hour our aim is to get as many people
home as soon as possible
and of course our priority is to get
home give people chance to get home
who've been waiting since our flights
were canceled on Wednesday and Thursday
it will take a little bit of time and I
know how frustrating is to not know
exactly how long it's going to take you
to get home from your holidays so we
will advise people to stay in touch with
your airline in the first instance to
find out the best time to come to the
airport but we have a big British
government team here on the ground now
ready to provide help and information of
the Egyptian authorities been blocking
the arrival of empty planes from the UK
to take holidaymakers home no we have
very good cooperation the first few
flights are leaving now as I said there
will be more flights during the day and
we will continue to work until we have
everybody home it's the challenging
difficult logistical issues to work
through this is a busy Airport and we
need to make sure people leave in a way
that's safe and is in line with
international international aviation
regulation and that's what we're doing
and we've got very very good progress
within our collaboration with the
Egyptians whether you're aware
ambassador that the passengers were told
by easyJet that the Egyptians were
blocking the arrival of planes I'm just
wondering if you can shed any any light
on that as I said the two easyJet planes
are leaving now more planes from all the
airlines will be leaving in the time
ahead and our of course we need to make
sure that people is happened an orderly
way and they will be leaving as soon as
possible at the right time so that it's
safe and people's time is managed as
well as possible
